entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested, Released on Bail in First-Degree Sexual Abuse Case
entry.summary: Jason Nathaniel Briggs, 43, of Roseburg, was arrested Oct. 28 on a charge of first-degree sexual abuse and later released on bail. Court records show three no-contact orders were issued. He’s due back in court Dec. 15 for a status hearing. The case remains under investigation.

entry.title: Southbound I-5 semi-truck fire near Winston extinguished
entry.summary: Fire crews extinguished a semi-truck fire on I-5 southbound near Winston Thursday morning. The blaze started in the engine compartment and spread to the cab and trailer loaded with paper rolls. No injuries were reported, and the cause is under investigation.

entry.title: Appeal Filed in Fatal UCC Softball Team Crash Case
entry.summary: A notice of appeal has been filed in the case of Jonathan Dowdy, sentenced to over 20 years for the fatal UCC softball team bus crash. Records show his sentence matched the plea agreement, and his earliest possible release date remains March 22, 2044.

entry.title: Oregon Connections 2025 Brings Together Broadband Leaders in Hood River
entry.summary: The 2025 Oregon Connections Telecommunications Conference brought more than 255 participants to Hood River for two days of learning, discussion, and connection. Broadband leaders, policymakers, and innovators from across Oregon gathered to share insights and advance the state’s work toward reliable, high-speed connectivity for all communities. entry.title: Grants Pass Awards $1.2 Million Homelessness Grant to Roseburg Developer
entry.summary: Grants Pass re-awarded a $1.2 million homelessness grant to Roseburg’s Elk Island Trading Group, which plans to build a container-home village for 150 people by summer 2026. The project could help the city close unmanaged camps and meet shelter space requirements.

entry.title: Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights Returns for 32nd Year
entry.summary: The 32nd annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights opens Nov. 23 at River Forks Park! Enjoy over half a million lights, 90+ displays, the World’s Largest Nutcracker, and the Dutch Bros Holiday Village. Open nightly at 5:30 p.m. through Jan. 1. More at UVFestivalofLights.com.

entry.title: Stewart Park “Green Bridge” Reopens - and It’s No Longer Green
entry.summary: Roseburg’s iconic “Green Bridge” has reopened after months of rehabilitation work, but it’s now black. Crews completed repairs, deck upgrades, and repainting to extend the bridge’s life and improve safety, restoring a key route between Stewart Parkway and the VA Medical Center.

entry.title: UCAN Preparing to Open Roseburg Warming Center for Third Winter
entry.summary: UCAN is reopening the Roseburg Warming Center for a third winter, offering warmth, food, and shelter during freezing nights. The center opens when temps drop to 30°F or below. Volunteers and donations are needed—sign up at housinghomelessservices.as.me/volunteerorientation.

entry.title: TRUE WEALTH 11.4.25
entry.summary: Presented by Littlejohn Financial, David Littlejohn and Matt Dickson have an encore program, which originally aired on August 20, 2024.

entry.title: Securing Your Future: Choosing the Right Financing for Your Business Property
entry.summary: For a growing business, the decision to move from leasing to owning commercial real estate (CRE) represents a major strategic inflection point. While leasing offers flexibility and capital preservation in the short term, ownership is a powerful long-term tool for stability, wealth creation, and operational control. Once the decision to buy is made, securing the… The post Securing Your Future: Choosing the Right Financing for Your Business Property appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Douglas County Man Arrested on Felony Sexual Abuse Charge
entry.summary: Douglas County deputies arrested 43-year-old Jason Nathaniel Briggs on Oct. 31 for first-degree sexual abuse, a Class B felony. Investigators say the victim, a minor known to Briggs, reported years of abuse. He remains in the Douglas County Jail.

entry.title: USDA Blocks SNAP Discount, but Roseburg Grocery Outlet Finds a Way to Help
entry.summary: Roseburg Grocery Outlet’s planned 10% discount for SNAP recipients was blocked by the USDA, but owners Steve and Kelly Burton found a workaround—partnering with FISH Food Pantry to offer 10% off cards to anyone in need throughout November, no verification required.

entry.title: Douglas County Joins Operation Green Light to Honor Veterans
entry.summary: Douglas County will again take part in Operation Green Light this November, lighting the courthouse green to honor veterans and their families. Residents are encouraged to join by displaying a green light at home to show gratitude and support for those who have served.

entry.title: Douglas County Search and Rescue Locates Two Missing Men
entry.summary: Douglas County Search and Rescue located two missing men in separate incidents last week. A Myrtle Creek hunter was found safe Friday morning, and an Eugene man stuck in the Umpqua National Forest was located Sunday evening in good health after being stranded for four days.

During the incident, Phegley reportedly pushed his way...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR REPORTED ROBBERY AT STORE
entry.summary: November 3, 2025 9:20 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for a reported robbery on Saturday. An RPD report said just after 10:50 a.m. officers contacted 29-year-old Landon Colvin outside a business in the 1000 block of West Harvard Avenue. An employee reported that Colvin had stolen a beer, valued at just under $3 from...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 11.3.25
entry.summary: Jennifer Ellis and Dorine Kirkes of the Associates of Vietnam Veterans talk about a Spousal and Survivor’s Benefits Seminar happening on Saturday.

entry.title: Woodwork, clothing, foods and more: Fall Craft Fair had projects of all sort
entry.summary: Under a Black Sign that said Custom Wood Creations, Roy Hopkins sat on a wood bench and watched people at the Fall Craft Fair on Saturday in Roseburg.
